job_title: Head Athletic Trainer in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Great Staff, Great Location, Good Leadership
cons: Long Hours, OK compensation, Facilities OK

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Compensation was decent in certain roles, great education benefits and time off, however, taking earned time off is never encouraged and you are often punished for it.
cons: Administration cares only about themselves and their status. No respect for faculty, students or staff. No accountability from Board to those in leadership roles. It’s basically a dictatorship with those under him living in fear or complete disinterest in their jobs anymore because of the extreme micromanagement, gaslighting and lack of empowering talented, caring people to do their jobs. What was once a great place that needed some forward momentum became a desolate, sad, revolving door of employees who either got pushed out because they spoke up or got wise and left because they were unable to do the job they were hired to do.

job_title: Alumni Relations in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Laid back, everyone was nice, professional and friendly, work load was very easy.
cons: Sometimes the job would be redundant and boring. No room for advancement and I was let go due to my position being furloughed.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Norfolk, VA
pros: The students are nice, and outside of the administration, most of the staff and faculty are good people.
cons: This used to be a great place to work, but since the new president arrived it has become completely toxic. Staff are continually quitting or being forced to quit or "retire", so everything is understaffed and no one is properly trained, but you are berated, belittled, and, if you have direct contact with the president, literally screamed at when you cannot do the impossible things you are asked to do. As an example, the ENTIRE registrar staff quit together after being continually downsized and abused. Do not take a job here if you value your mental health.

review_title: Not worth it for the experienced higher ed professional
job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Norfolk, VA
pros: Outside of calling hours, not a large workload. Working day started at 9:30.
cons: I am not sure I would even recommend this job to a fresh-out-of-college graduate. If you have any experience in higher ed, this is not the place for you. Their recruitment strategies are archaic and do not reflect the current needs/communication styles of current college-bound high school students. The low-ball salary in addition to the out-of-date expectations of employees is not worth it.

review_title: Great if you NEED a job, not a career.
job_title: IT Specialist in Virginia Beach, VA
pros:
More of a relaxed environment.
Staff are generally more understanding, and some genuinely want to help.
Most of the IT Team is helpful.
You find your clique pretty quickly, and with it being a small private college, there are definitely budget constraints, but you get a jist of your favorite co-workers early on.
cons:
Faculty and student tuition are what really run the school, and it is very apparent.
No open discussion; you may be heard but make no mistake, no one is listening.
Everyone in nearly every department is so set in their ways that they are blind to the major issues, and unable to comprehend any changes that are needed.
NO accountability for other team members // no checks and balancing of the workload.
No real policies that affect anything. No true rules. No actual chain of command. Just the wild west -- in a bad way.
This is not your dream job or dream company. Does not value their employees on most levels, especially compensation wise.

job_title: Student Worker in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: The hours were super flexible and often times they allowed you to work on homework while on the clock if it wasn't too busy.
cons: There were very few cons of the job that couldn't be outweighed by the plethora of perks. My only regret is that they changed the job from hourly wage to annual stipend which made the job incredibly difficult to sustain.

job_title: Professor in Norfolk, VA
pros: Students are great, colleagues too.
cons: Administration sucks, changes made without real faculty input.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: They have a competitive benefits package and excellent hours.
cons: It's a quite small college.

job_title: Assistant Coach in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Flexible work hours and expectations
cons: Poor management and subpar culture

job_title: Office Assistant in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Good job, fun people to work with.
cons: Only made minimum wage which sucked

review_title: big problems, little prospect for positive change in near future.
job_title: in Norfolk, VA
pros: Strong sense of community among faculty, although much of that comes from shared hardship.
cons: No long term planning for the future, especially in Admissions and Finance. Finance and Student Affairs seem to be actively obstructing improvements on the Academic side. Dozens of fiefdoms jealously protected by incompetent, under-qualified, overpaid, risk-averse bureaucrats, and some of the faculty are just as bad. The campus facilities are embarrassing. We're now paying the price for building everything on the cheap decades ago. President of the college is asleep at the wheel, focused on unrealistic goals while blowing smoke the rest of the time.

review_title: Money for administrators; none for faculty
job_title: Associate Professor in Norfolk, VA
pros: The college is experience a forward momentum not seen in decades.
cons: We are told repeatedly that there is no money for investment in academic departments... no new hires, no funding for growing programs. However, there seems to be plenty of money for new administrators and for administrative promotions. Needless to say, this leaves a sour taste in the mouths of faculty, many of whom have heard the "next year, next year" mantra for far too long.

job_title: Hub Desk in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Prob the easiest job for financial aid. I had fun doing the job and even put in a lot of effort.
cons: Sometimes unreasonable hours even scheduled during classes sometimes. And had to continually come in when I was severely sick. Also, the gossiping of some co-workers and their attitudes towards some of the students in Batten really takes away from the work environment.

job_title: Assistant Director in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Small operation, great ability to have an immediate influence on outcomes for students without wading through lots of red tape. Good benefits.
cons: Constantly under resourced. Poor training. Tendency to grind certain positions into dust and then replace staff. Small operation so advancement opportunities are limited until someone higher on org chart leaves.

review_title: The cons of working at this institution heavily outweigh the pros.
job_title: in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Sense of community,
Nice retirement and leave benefits
Small student body allows for much interaction
Much potential to be a great place
cons:
Lack of comprehensive administrative plan
Poor faculty support in recruitment and retention
Employees disappear overnight
Iocals either know nothing about college or have very respect
Neighborhoods surrounding campus have highest crime rates in city

review_title: Friendly place to work; embarrassingly low compensation
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Norfolk, VA
pros:
- Great work/life balance within department
- Generous healthcare / dental benefits with VERY low monthly premiums
- Friendly coworkers
- Personal leave accrues quickly
cons:
- Mean salary for IT nowhere close to industry standards
- Low salary overall for administrative & support staff 
- Lack of diversity (particularly minority women)
- Departments tend to be understaffed - difficult to take time off
- Zero opportunity for promotion unless people quit

review_title: The faculty and staff are top of their class, and the University offers an excellent atmosphere for achievement.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Too many pros to mention here. VWU continues to grow and excel on all levels. We now offer online courses, making this a learning environment for everyone.
cons: I honestly cannot think of any cons to working at VWU. I’m thankful for what higher ed has to offer. Top notch all the way!

job_title: in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Outstanding atmosphere, family feel throughout the campus, attractive campus, close to everything a major metropolitan area has to offer, especially the beaches and ocean
cons: Nothing serious enough to mention...the College continues to grow, with the usual growing pains...but overall a great place to work

review_title: Virginia Wesleyan is a good institution that is still making improvements like any other corporation or organization.
job_title: Resident Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: The work environment is great, and there are good benefits.
cons: Sometimes the administration can be overbearing, but flexible nonetheless.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Family like environment. Great leadership. Great location.
cons: pay was good for on campus college student, not much else.

job_title: Ambassador in Norfolk, VA
pros: They pay you and the work study works around your school schedule.
cons: They teach their employees to lie about the poorness of the college.

job_title: Batten Center Supervisor in Norfolk, VA
pros: Flexible work hours and duration
cons: Pay is $8.50 and only students are able to apply.  Sometimes the schedule is not reasonable or distribute equal amount of hours.

job_title: Security Supervisor and Internal Fire Marshall in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Its an interesting place to work. There are very few days that are the same.
cons: Getting time off is very difficult in my position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Norfolk, VA
pros: I worked at sodexo foods. pros. free food, flexible schedule and you can get a yearly raise...
cons: There is not a full time pay check anymore

job_title: in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great work environment, great salary, great hours
cons: great company to work for

job_title: Campus Security Officer in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Health plan
Free tuition
Some good people
cons: Incompetent autocrat who will treat you worse than the worms inside the dirt.
